translations.translation: Before that they were living in luxury,
They were endowed with good things
Surely they had lived before in luxury,
They had lived in luxury before this
Indeed they were among favours before this.
Verily, before that, they indulged in luxury,
Surely they were before that made to live in ease and plenty.
and before that they lived at ease,
Lo! heretofore they were effete with luxury
They had been affluent before,
Verily they have been heretofore affluent.
Indeed they had been affluent before this,
For that they were wont to be indulged, before that, in wealth (and luxury),
Verily, before that, they indulged in luxury,
Before they lived at ease,
They had lived before that in luxury.
Indeed they were, before that, indulging in affluence,
[56:45] Indeed before that, in the world, they used to live at ease, enjoying [life’s] comforts, never wearying themselves with [an act of] obedience,

(Lo! Heretofore) in the life of the world (they were effete with luxury) they were prodigal; it is also said that this means: they were immersed in comfort; and it is also said that this means: they were bewildered.

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { إِنَّهُمْ كَانُواْ قَبْلَ ذَلِكَ مُتْرَفِينَ } معناه متكبرونَ

translations.translation: And His saying, “Indeed, they were before that indulgent” [means that] they were arrogant.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: وبالجملة: { إِنَّهُمْ } من شدة سكرتهم وغفلتهم { كَانُواْ قَبْلَ ذَلِكَ } في النشأة الأولى { مُتْرَفِينَ } [الواقعة: 45] منهمكين في الضلال والشهوات

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text: { إِنهم كانوا قبل ذلك } أي: في الدنيا { مُتْرَفِينَ } منعّمين بأنواع النِعَم، من المآكل والمشارب، والمساكن الطيبة، والمقامات الكريمة، منهمكين في الشهوات، فمَنَعَهم ذلك من الانزجار، وشَغَلَهم عن الاعتبار
